snippet: New York City’s deputy commissioner for water and sewer operations has been busy since a large water main burst on Wednesday in Greenwich Village.
abstract: Jim Roberts, deputy commissioner for water and sewer operations for the New York City Department of Environment Protection, oversees extensive and in some cases antiquated water system carrying one billion gallons a day to city from upstate reservoirs; Roberts is kept especially busy when water mains break, sending water gushing to wrong places.
lead_paragraph: New York City’s deputy commissioner for water and sewer operations has been busy since a large water main burst on Wednesday in Greenwich Village.

headline.main: Water Is His Life, Particularly When It Starts Gushing in All the Wrong Places
headline.print_headline: Water Is His Life, Particularly When It Starts Gushing in All the Wrong Places
